name: Fare Suisse Tahiti

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beni provides transportation to/and airport and ferry station; it makes things much easier
reviews.title: Very convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is centrally located but at the same time it is not in the middle of the traffic and the city noise. It was very clean!!!!
reviews.title: Perfect Guest House; Would Love to Come Back and Stay Longer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We definitively will come back!
reviews.title: Lucky to find this place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed here one night on a stopover from Los Angeles to Auckland. It was a perfect experience.
reviews.title: Rare find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was extremely clean, modern, and comfortable. Extremely quiet as well. The property itself is a beautiful location on a hillside, with good views of the town and the harbor. Nice garden and lounge area. Beni (the owner) picked us up from the airport as promised (early evening flight), was very nice, and gave us good tips and directions to town (it's an easy walk).
reviews.title: Nice Guesthouse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't be more pleased that we took the advice from Trip Advisor ratings and spent 3 nights at Fare Suisse. Everything good that you read about the place and its owner was found to be true during our visit.
reviews.title: Fantastic Service, Very Nice Accomodations, All At A Terrific Rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: We returned to French Polynesia to celebrate our 5-year wedding anniversary. Our trip consisted of stays on two islands (Fakarava and Moorea...see our other reviews) over the course of 11 days. In between, we needed a place to stay in Papeete a couple of times. This is where Fare Suisse was perfect for us.
reviews.title: Friendly, efficient, clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Our flight from LAX arrived in Papeete around 6pm. Beni was there waiting for us at the airport when we cleared customs. He loaded us and our bags into his vehicle and drove us to Fare Suisse. This is one of the big benefits that he provides - transportation to/from the airport and the ferry terminal is included in his already reasonable nightly rate.
reviews.title: Scandinavian purity meets Organic Jungle Feng Shui

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010
reviews.text: We stayed the night of our arrival and the room was very comfortable. The common area provided a place to relax and unwind, while enjoying a cold Hinano from the honor bar in the kitchen area. By the way, his prices in the honor bar are not outrageous.
reviews.title: Fare Suisse: Fantastic value in Pape'ete!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Early the next morning, I was able to use the free wi-fi (another great benefit) on the patio before heading to the Champion supermarket which is just a few minutes walk from Fare Suisse. It's the best option for loading up on food and beverages at a reasonable cost. You can bring stuff back and store in the kitchen at Fare Suisse.
reviews.title: The Fare Suisse is a fine place where to stay in Tahiti

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our dream vacation to French Polynesia for our 30th wedding anniversary began very pleasantly, thanks to Bini and his wonderful guest house Fare-Suisse. We arrived at the Fa'a International Airport late at night due to there being only one flight option for us. Having stayed in pensions and B&Bs across the world we were optimistic but had some concern what our accommodations would be like as Tahiti is notoriously expensive and the place we found on the internet seemed so reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Great guest house in Tahiti

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Immediately we were spared fumbling our way around while tired and in a new place where the primary language is one we do not speak well, due to the gracious hospitality of Beni the owner of Fare-Suisse. As soon as we cleared customs Beni was there smiling with our name on a sign. He drove us in a spacious van to his wonderful guest house nestled on a hillside overlooking the town and harbor where a sparkling clean bedroom with private bath and air conditioning awaited us. Nothing like starting a trip with a great night sleep and that is just what we had at Fare-Suisse.
reviews.title: What a find.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: In the morning it was an easy walk to all the sights of Papeete. In fact we could see our cruise ship from the patio of Fare-Suisse. When we finished touring the town Beni gave us a ride to our cruise ship so we did not have to drag our luggage the few blocks to the harbor.
reviews.title: Great service and a nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: In a part of the world where many essentials to travel are very expensive, we are pleased to say Fare-Suisse was a remarkably good value. We can unhesitatingly give the highest possible recommendation to Fare-Suisse. We cannot imagine staying anywhere else on a return trip to Papeete.
reviews.title: Read why Fare-Suisse is the best place to start hopping islands in FP

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were lucky enough to score a room at Fare Suisse at the last minute as we headed to Tahiti for a short holiday. This place is a great deal - clean, comfortable, new… and the proprietor, Beni, was just charming... a fabulous addition to the hotel scene in Papeete.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay in Papeete

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fare-Suisse is an excellent guesthouse run by very capable, super-friendly and incredibly helpful staff. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable and the breakfast was great. We were collected at the airport when we arrived and dropped off at the ferry terminal when we left. Fare-Suisse was definitely one of the most friendly and helpful guesthouse we've stayed at in almost 10 months of travelling around the world.
reviews.title: Friendly & helpful staff, good location, great guesthouse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fare-Suisse is an excellent affordable option in downtown Tahiti. During honeymoon planning we were looking for a place to stay one night on either end of trip on the way in/out to the islands. After thorough research online for a place to stay, Lonely Planet Guide and TripAdvisor, I selected Fare-Suisse based on its' customer feedback, affordable pricing and location. This simply is the best alternative to to any high priced resort or hotel near the airport. Beni's service is excellent and he does pick up and drop off airport runs at
reviews.title: Excellent Affordable Stay just steps from Downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: no charge. He even mad an early 5am run to the airport for us. Rooms were spotless and provided everything one would need. Short walkable distance to town was another benefit.
reviews.title: Comfortable and Efficient Family-run Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I would not hesitate to go back here again.
reviews.title: Like coming home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at Fare Suisse for 3 nights prior to our cruise on the Aranui 3. Beni and the Fare Suisse staff were gracious and efficient responding to our every request. Beni picked us up at the airport and dropped us off at the cruise terminal, always on time, and the room was clean and comfortable. There was plenty of hot water for the shower and filtered tap water available on site. Beni was very helpful when we asked for advice about how to spend our time, and recommended a half-day tour of Tahiti that we enjoyed, but he didn't push the tours on us, like they do at some places. A nice, unexpected surprise of our visit was getting to know the other guests who also chose a small, family-run penison rather than one of the large, generic hotels. We met some friendly, interesting people at breakfast and in the evenings sitting on the veranda listening to one of Beni's many CDs of local music. I would definitely enjoy staying at Fare Suisse again.
reviews.title: Awesome service

description: Fare Suisse is a homey pension in the capital of French Polynesia, Papeete. The pension is 10 minutes away from the airport and offers comfortable access to the harbour and to the shopping area as well to all place of interest of Papeete.
